thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Cold War 2.0
As Russia prepares to hold its national election this weekend—with President Vladimir Putin poised to win comfortably—the freeze with Europe and the U.S. deepens. The Trump administration introduced new sanctions against Moscow for meddling in the 2016 presidential campaign and waging cyberattacks on critical U.S. infrastructure such as power grids. They target 19 individuals and five entities, some already hit by previous rounds, in what analysts agree is largely a symbolic strike. Washington has... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
